intro: Erigeron andicola f. pleiocephalus, commonly known as the Andean fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to cold and harsh conditions. Its foliage is usually grayish-green, with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. The flowers bloom in shades of white to pale blue, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
